item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "When others demand that we become the people they want us to be, they force us to destroy the person we really are. It's a subtle kind of murder ... the most loving parents and relatives commit this murder with smiles on their faces." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "That's what real love amounts to - letting a person be what he really is. Most people love you for who you pretend to be. To keep their love, you keep pretending - performing. You get to love your pretence. It's true, we're locked in an image, an act - and the sad thing is, people get so used to their image, they grow attached to their masks. They love their chains. They forget all about who they really are. And if you try to remind them, they hate you for it, they feel like you're trying to steal their most precious possession." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim MORRISON
item.description: "The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You trade in your sense for an act. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask. There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first." -- Jim MORRISON

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "People are afraid of themselves, of their own reality; their feelings most of all. People talk about how great love is, but that’s bullshit. Love hurts. Feelings are disturbing. People are taught that pain is evil and dangerous. How can they deal with love if they’re afraid to feel? Pain is meant to wake us up. People try to hide their pain. But they’re wrong. Pain is something to carry, like a radio. You feel your strength in the experience of pain. It’s all in how you carry it. That’s what matters. Pain is a feeling. Your feelings are a part of you. Your own reality. If you feel ashamed of them, and hide them, you’re letting society destroy your reality. You should stand up for your right to feel your pain." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Where's your will to be weird?" -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by jim morrison
item.description: "The future is uncertain but the end is always near." -- jim morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "No one here gets out alive." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I think of myself as an intelligent, sensitive human being with the soul of a clown which always forces me to blow it at the most important moments." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I like people who shake other people up and make them feel uncomfortable." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I think the highest and lowest points are the important ones. Anything else is just...in between." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "There are things known and there are things unknown and in between are the doors." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "People are strange . . ." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Death makes angels of us all and gives us wings where we had shoulders round as ravens claws." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I've noticed that when people are joking they're usually dead serious, and when they're serious, they're usually pretty funny." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Actually I don't remember being born, it must have happened during one of my black outs." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Man, I'm sick of doubt." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I believe in a long, prolonged, derangement of the senses in order to obtain the unknown." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I love the friends I have gathered together on this thin raft..." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Is everybody in? Is everybody in? Is everybody in? The ceremony is about to begin. The entertainment for this evening is not new, you've seen this entertainment through and through you have seen your birth, your life, your death....you may recall all the rest. Did you have a good world when you died? -enough to base a movie on??" -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "People fear death even more than pain. It's strange that they fear death. Life hurts a lot more than death. At the point of death, the pain is over. Yeah, I guess it is a friend" -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Film spectators are quiet vampires." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Between childhood, boyhood, adolescence and manhood (maturity) there should be sharp lines drawn with tests, deaths, feats, rites, stories, songs, and judgments." -- Jim Morrison
